hero.title: Full-Stack Developer
hero.subtitle: Expert in web and mobile application development using Java, Spring Framework, Kotlin, Swift/SwiftUI, and Flutter

about.title: About Me
about.subtitle: Get to know me
about.p1: I am a developer who creates web and mobile applications using various technology stacks such as Java, Spring Framework, and Flutter. I have experience in financial sector projects including Woori Bank, Shinhan Bank, and KB Kookmin Card, and possess comprehensive development capabilities from Android native app development to backend server development.
about.p2: I strive to become a better developer through continuous learning and growth, and recently completed a Spring Framework-based Java Full-Stack developer training course to acquire the latest technologies.
about.intlExpDesc: 2010.07 ~ 2011.05 - Participation in World Job Training Program (Canadagate IT Business Practice Course) by Korea Human Resources Development Service
about.intlExpItem1: Completed approximately 4 months of Advanced course (Toefl) classes after level test
about.intlExpItem2: Self-development for acquiring local English skills and developing potential abilities
about.intlExpItem3: Attended Brain-based Speed Reading seminars in USA and Canada
about.studyDesc: 2017.05 ~ 2017.11 - IAMROOT Offline System SW Study Group
about.studyItem1: 3-hour weekly meetings on 'Artificial Intelligence' as a sub-group
about.studyItem2: Studied machine learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning basics using video lectures
about.studyItem3: Hands-on practice with Tensorflow, PyTorch & Keras

competencies.title: Core Competencies
competencies.subtitle: Introducing my key strengths
competencies.item1_desc1: Experience in resolving issues across various system environments: Extensive experience in solving technical issues in diverse environments, from embedded Linux-based system firmware development (forklift transmissions, mobile routers) to Android native apps and Spring-based web servers.
competencies.item1_desc2: Problem-solving through collaboration: Successfully resolved the 'secure keypad issue' in the 'Hana Bank Linebank' project and the 'app encryption and build system' issue in the 'Shinhan Bank Ddangyo' project through collaboration with external solution providers and partners. This demonstrates the ability to grasp the core of complex problems and solve them through smooth communication with relevant stakeholders.
competencies.item1_desc3: CI/CD environment construction and automation: Experience in directly building a 'local CI/CD environment' using Jenkins, Docker, and GitLab in the 'Woori Bank WON Banking' project, and managing the 'encryption/build system' using Docker in the 'Shinhan Bank Ddangyo' project, proves problem-solving skills in improving development process inefficiencies and building a stable deployment environment.
competencies.item2_desc1: Continuous completion of professional training: Systematically learned new technology stacks, from C/C++ based embedded systems to Java/Spring and Flutter, by completing long-term professional training courses such as the 'Embedded SW Expert Course (960 hours)' and 'Java Full-Stack Developer Training Course (944 hours)'.
competencies.item2_desc2: Acquisition and application of new technologies: Successfully learned 'Kotlin' and 'Django' through the 'Hana Bank Linebank' project and applied them to actual app development and internal deployment site construction. In the 'Kiwoom Securities' project, constantly expanded technical capabilities by acquiring and utilizing the latest technologies such as 'C++11, Boost.Asio, and ECMAScript 6'.
competencies.item2_desc3: Proactive learning and knowledge sharing: Voluntarily studied machine learning and deep learning through 'AI Study Group' activities. The review from the 'Woori Bank' project, which states "learned new technologies and shared them with colleagues," confirms a proactive attitude of contributing acquired knowledge to the team.
competencies.item3_desc1: Database design and modeling capabilities: Learned 'E-R Diagram creation' and 'conceptual/logical/physical database modeling' in the 'Oracle' training course. Experience linking relational databases using MyBatis, Spring Data, etc., in numerous projects supports the ability to understand and effectively design data structures.
competencies.item3_desc2: Understanding and application of AI and machine learning technologies: Studied machine learning/deep learning theories and practiced with Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc., through an 'Artificial Intelligence' study group. In the recent 'Miracle Reading' project, directly integrated generative AI into the service using 'Spring AI, Oracle 23c AI, Ollama', demonstrating the ability to utilize data-based AI technology.
competencies.item3_desc3: Implementation of data-driven features: Experience participating in the 'KB Kookmin Card MyData' project shows the capability to understand and develop data-driven services that create new value by collecting and integrating scattered personal data through standard APIs.

projects.title: Projects
projects.subtitle: Major Projects
projects.proj1_intro: A full-stack web application to encourage reading habits and manage books, featuring AI-powered summaries, reading plans, speed-reading training, and social features.
projects.proj1_review:
üìö Project Overview

Miracle Reading System is a comprehensive web application for forming reading habits and managing books. It provides AI-based book summaries, reading plan management, speed-reading training, and social features.

üéØ Key Features Implemented

1. User Authentication & Management
  • Auth Methods: Form-based login (BCrypt hashing), Google OAuth2, Kakao OAuth2
  • User Management: Registration, profile management, account deletion with DeletedUser backup
  • Session Management: Concurrent session control (max 1), admin session separation
2. Book Management
  • Aladin Open API: Automatic book info collection by ISBN
  • Bulk Upload: Parse ISBN lists from markdown files
  • Book Lookup & Admin: Paging, AJAX-based detail lookups
3. AI-based Book Summarization
  • Ollama Local LLM: Integrated Qwen3:1.7b via Spring AI
  • Summary Types: Full, short, brief, AI summary
  • Concurrency Control: Prevent concurrent summary requests with ConcurrentHashMap
  • Summary Management: Save keywords (up to 10), questions (up to 10), mindmap data
4. Reading Plans & Records
  • Weekly/monthly/yearly goals with automatic achievement calculation
  • Reading schedules (missions) per book with status management
  • Daily page logs via AJAX, cumulative page calculation
  • Reading statistics and summary counts
5. Speed-Reading Training
  • Visual field expansion and dynamic focus training
  • Adjustable-speed reading practice with tracking
6. Gallery & Social Features
  • Public summary gallery with keyword search
  • Likes, bookmarks, comment system (nested comments)
  • Usage statistics and popularity metrics
7. Mindmap Functionality
  • Store and retrieve mindmap data in JSON format
  • Link mindmaps to book summaries
8. Admin Console
  • Separate admin authentication and session handling
  • Admin user management, book management, bulk upload

üõ† Tech Stack

Backend
  • Language: Java 17
  • Framework: Spring Boot 3.3.5 (Spring MVC, Spring Security, Spring Data JPA, Spring AI, OAuth2 Client)
  • Database: Oracle
  • ORM: Hibernate (JPA), HikariCP
Frontend
  • JSP with Bootstrap 5 and jQuery
AI & External APIs
  • Spring AI with Ollama local LLM (Qwen3:1.7b)
  • Aladin Open API, Google/Kakao OAuth2

üèó Architecture & Outcomes

Layered architecture (Presentation, Service, Repository) with emphasis on modularity, performance optimization, and security.

üí° Project Review

Using CURSOR AI improved developer productivity across code generation, refactoring, debugging, and documentation tasks, enabling efficient full-stack development as a solo engineer.
projects.proj2_intro: A cross-platform productivity app built with Flutter providing todo management, idea journal, reading cards, weather, and news feeds.
projects.proj2_review:
üìã Project Overview

Productivity Hub is a Flutter-based cross-platform productivity app that provides the following core features:

  • Todo Management: Add/edit/delete todos, toggle completion status
  • Idea Journal: Organize ideas by category
  • Reading Cards: Track reading progress, save keywords and short summaries
  • Weather: Current location and city-based weather lookup
  • News Feed: Curated AI and quantum computing related news

üéØ Key Implemented Features

1. Todo Management
  • Add/edit/delete todos and toggle completion
  • Automatically record completion timestamps
  • Swipe-to-delete gesture support
2. Idea Journal
  • Manage ideas by categories (tech, business, design, other)
  • Add/edit/delete ideas
3. Reading Cards
  • Track reading status (in-progress/completed/paused)
  • Save up to 5 key keywords
  • Record short summaries
  • Manage target and actual completion dates
4. Weather
  • Current location based weather lookup (Geolocator)
  • Search weather by city name (Geocoding API)
  • 24-hour hourly forecast
  • 7-day daily forecast
  • Convert WMO weather codes to descriptions and emojis
5. News Feed
  • AI and quantum computing related news
  • Multi RSS feed parsing (Google News, Reddit, ArXiv)
  • Category filtering (All/AI/Quantum)
  • Open article detail and external URLs

üõ† Tech Stack

Core Framework
  • Flutter: 3.x
  • Dart SDK: >=3.0.0 <4.0.0
Main Packages
  • State Management: Provider (^6.1.1) - ChangeNotifier based
  • Data Storage: sqflite (^2.3.0), path (^1.8.3), shared_preferences (^2.2.2)
  • Network: http (^1.1.0), dio (^5.4.0)
  • Location: geolocator (^13.0.1), permission_handler (^12.0.1)
  • Utilities: intl (^0.20.2), url_launcher (^6.2.2), xml (^6.4.2), cached_network_image (^3.3.1), flutter_tts (^4.0.2)

üèó Architecture Pattern

Provider pattern (MVVM-like) is used for state management:

  • UI Layer: Screens (Views) - HomeScreen, TodoScreen, IdeaScreen, ReadingCardScreen, WeatherScreen, NewsScreen
  • State Management: Providers (ViewModels) - TodoProvider, IdeaProvider, ReadingCardProvider, WeatherProvider, NewsProvider
  • Data Layer: Models, DatabaseHelper (SQLite/SharedPreferences), HTTP APIs (Open-Meteo, RSS Feeds)

üìä Data Flow

Local Data (Todo, Idea, ReadingCard)

Screen ‚Üí Provider ‚Üí DatabaseHelper ‚Üí SQLite/SharedPreferences

Remote Data (Weather, News)

Screen ‚Üí Provider ‚Üí HTTP GET ‚Üí External API

üåê External API Integrations

Weather API (Open-Meteo)
  • Free, no API key required
  • Geocoding API: convert city name to coordinates
  • Weather Forecast API: current weather, hourly and daily forecasts
News API (RSS feeds)
  • Free, no API key required
  • Google News RSS: AI and Quantum Computing related news
  • Reddit RSS: r/QuantumComputing, r/artificial, r/MachineLearning
  • ArXiv RSS: cs.AI, quant-ph papers
  • CORS: Use a CORS proxy for web (api.allorigins.win)

üíæ Database Schema

DatabaseHelper (singleton) - platform-specific persistence:

  • Mobile (Android/iOS): SQLite (sqflite)
  • Web: SharedPreferences (JSON fallback)
Main Tables
  • todos: id, title, description, is_completed, created_at, updated_at, completed_at
  • ideas: id, title, content, category, created_at, updated_at
  • reading_cards: id, title, author, total_pages, start_date, target_end_date, actual_end_date, keywords, summary, status

üì± Platform Support

  • Android: ‚úÖ Full SQLite and location support
  • iOS: ‚úÖ Full SQLite and location support
  • Web: ‚úÖ SharedPreferences fallback, limited location, CORS proxy required
  • Windows: ‚úÖ SQLite support

‚ú® Key Features

  • Free: All used APIs are free and require no API keys
  • Cross-platform: Android, iOS, Web, Windows support
  • Offline support: Local DB persistence
  • Material Design 3: Modern UI system
  • Korean locale: Korean date/time formatting supported

üìÇ Project Structure

Organized in layered structure:

  • lib/database/: DatabaseHelper singleton
  • lib/models/: Data models (Todo, Idea, ReadingCard, Weather, NewsArticle)
  • lib/providers/: State management (Provider pattern - ChangeNotifier)
  • lib/screens/: UI screens (HomeScreen, TodoScreen, IdeaScreen, ReadingCardScreen, WeatherScreen, NewsScreen, NewsDetailScreen)

üîß App Initialization Flow

  1. Initialize Korean locale (initializeDateFormatting)
  2. Initialize database (DatabaseHelper.instance.initialize)
  3. Configure MultiProvider (register 5 providers)
  4. Run app (MaterialApp)

üìà Future Improvements

  • Local notification support for todos
  • Idea search capability
  • Weather forecast graphs
  • Article bookmarks in news
  • Dark mode
  • Cloud backup/restore
  • Add unit/widget/integration tests
  • Refactor models with Freezed for immutability
  • Introduce Repository pattern
  • Adopt Clean Architecture
